tasks.title: Create Core Data Models and Schema
tasks.description: Design and implement the foundational data structures for tasks, lists, and user accounts. This establishes the database schema and ensures data integrity for all core entities. The data model must support future feature expansion while maintaining performance for the target user base.
tasks.featureContext: Foundational data structure needed for all task functionality
acceptanceCriteria: Task model includes id, title, description, due_date, priority, status, list_id, created_at, updated_at
List model includes id, name, user_id, created_at, updated_at
User model includes id, email, password_hash, created_at, updated_at
Database constraints enforce referential integrity
Migration scripts create tables with proper indexes
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle long task descriptions (text field vs varchar limits)
Ensure proper cascade behavior when lists are deleted
Account for timezone storage in date fields

tasks.title: Build User Authentication System
tasks.description: Implement secure user registration, login, and session management to protect user data and enable personalized task management. This includes password hashing, session tokens, and basic security measures. Authentication is essential before users can create and manage their tasks.
tasks.featureContext: Users need accounts to persist and secure their task data
acceptanceCriteria: Users can register with email and password
Users can login with valid credentials
Passwords are properly hashed and salted
Invalid login attempts are rejected with appropriate messages
User sessions persist across page refreshes
Users can logout and sessions are properly destroyed
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle duplicate email registration attempts
Prevent brute force attacks with rate limiting
Manage expired or invalid session tokens
Handle password reset requests (basic implementation)

tasks.title: Create Main Application Layout
tasks.description: Build the primary UI shell that contains navigation, header, and content areas. This layout provides the structural foundation for all application screens and ensures consistent user experience. The layout must be responsive and accommodate the sidebar navigation pattern common in productivity apps.
tasks.featureContext: UI framework needed to display and interact with tasks
acceptanceCriteria: Header contains app logo and user menu
Sidebar shows list navigation and user options
Main content area adjusts to available space
Layout is responsive on mobile, tablet, and desktop
Navigation between different sections works smoothly
User can access logout functionality from header
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle sidebar collapse on smaller screens
Ensure proper layout when no lists exist
Maintain layout integrity with very long list names

tasks.title: Implement List Management Interface
tasks.description: Create the UI components for creating, editing, and deleting task lists/categories. Users need to organize their tasks into logical groupings, so this interface must be intuitive and accessible. The design should emphasize quick list creation while providing options for list customization.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to organize tasks into logical categories for better focus
acceptanceCriteria: Users can create new lists with a name
List names can be edited inline or through modal
Lists can be deleted with confirmation dialog
Sidebar displays all user lists with task counts
Default 'General' list is created for new users
Active list is visually highlighted in navigation
edgeCasesToHandle: Prevent deletion of lists containing tasks without confirmation
Handle very long list names in sidebar
Ensure at least one list always exists
Validate list name length and special characters

tasks.title: Build API Endpoints for Core Operations
tasks.description: Develop REST API endpoints for task and list CRUD operations, ensuring proper data validation and error handling. These endpoints serve as the communication layer between frontend and backend, handling all core business logic. The API design must be consistent and extensible for future features.
tasks.featureContext: Frontend needs reliable API to persist and retrieve task data
acceptanceCriteria: POST /tasks creates new task with validation
GET /tasks returns user's tasks with filtering options
PUT /tasks/:id updates existing task
DELETE /tasks/:id removes task
POST /lists creates new list
GET /lists returns user's lists with task counts
All endpoints require authentication
Proper HTTP status codes returned for all scenarios
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle malformed JSON requests gracefully
Validate required fields and data types
Prevent users from accessing other users' data
Handle database connection failures
Return meaningful error messages for validation failures

tasks.title: Create Task Entry Interface
tasks.description: Build the primary task creation form that allows users to input task details including title, description, and basic properties. The interface should prioritize speed and ease of use, enabling users to quickly capture tasks without friction. This is the most frequently used feature and must feel responsive and intuitive.
tasks.featureContext: Core functionality enabling users to capture and organize work items
acceptanceCriteria: Users can enter task title and description
Form validates required fields before submission
New tasks are added to currently selected list
Form clears after successful task creation
Users can press Enter to quickly create tasks
Character count or limits are clearly indicated
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle network errors during task creation
Prevent empty or whitespace-only task titles
Show loading state during API calls
Handle very long task descriptions gracefully

tasks.title: Build Task Display and List View
tasks.description: Create the main interface for displaying tasks within lists, showing essential task information in a clean, scannable format. Users spend most of their time viewing and interacting with this list, so it must be optimized for readability and quick task identification. The view should handle varying amounts of content gracefully.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to view and scan their tasks efficiently
acceptanceCriteria: Tasks display title, description preview, and creation date
List shows task count and completion progress
Empty state shown when no tasks exist in list
Tasks are ordered by creation date (newest first) by default
Long task descriptions are truncated with expand option
Visual loading states while fetching tasks
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle lists with hundreds of tasks (pagination or virtual scrolling)
Display appropriate messages for network errors
Handle tasks with missing or corrupted data
Optimize rendering performance for large task lists

tasks.title: Implement Task Assignment to Lists
tasks.description: Build the functionality to assign tasks to specific lists during creation and enable moving tasks between lists. This supports the organizational structure users need to separate different areas of their life or work. The interface should make list assignment obvious and allow easy reorganization of tasks.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to organize tasks into logical categories for better focus
acceptanceCriteria: Tasks are automatically assigned to currently selected list
Users can move tasks between lists via dropdown or drag-and-drop
List task counts update immediately when tasks are moved
Tasks moved to deleted lists are reassigned to default list
API endpoints handle list assignment validation
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle moving tasks to non-existent lists
Prevent orphaned tasks when lists are deleted
Update UI immediately while API call is processing
Handle concurrent updates to task list assignments

tasks.title: Create Task Editing Interface
tasks.description: Build inline editing capabilities that allow users to modify task details without navigating to separate pages. Users frequently need to update task information, add details, or correct mistakes, so editing should be as frictionless as possible. The interface should clearly indicate edit mode and provide easy save/cancel options.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to modify task details after creation
riskFlags: Complex state management for inline editing
acceptanceCriteria: Users can click task elements to enter edit mode
Edit mode shows form fields with current values
Changes can be saved with Enter key or save button
Changes can be cancelled with Escape key or cancel button
Visual indicators clearly show edit mode vs view mode
Form validation prevents invalid updates
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle users clicking away while editing (auto-save or prompt)
Prevent multiple tasks from being edited simultaneously
Handle network errors during save operations
Revert to original values if save fails

tasks.title: Build Task Completion System
tasks.description: Implement checkbox interactions that allow users to mark tasks as complete or incomplete, with visual feedback to show task status. This core functionality provides the satisfying completion experience users expect from task management tools. Completed tasks should be visually distinct but remain accessible for review.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to track completion progress for motivation and organization
acceptanceCriteria: Users can click checkbox to toggle task completion
Completed tasks show strikethrough text and muted colors
List completion percentage updates immediately
Completed tasks can be marked incomplete again
Completion timestamp is recorded for history
Checkbox state persists after page refresh
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle rapid clicking on completion checkbox
Show appropriate state while API request processes
Handle completion toggle failures gracefully
Ensure completion status syncs across browser tabs

tasks.title: Implement Task Deletion
tasks.description: Build the capability to permanently remove tasks with appropriate confirmation to prevent accidental deletions. While task completion is the primary way to handle finished tasks, users also need to delete tasks that are no longer relevant. The deletion process should be accessible but protected against accidental activation.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to remove irrelevant or mistaken tasks
acceptanceCriteria: Delete button appears on task hover or in context menu
Confirmation dialog prevents accidental deletions
Deleted tasks are immediately removed from UI
List task counts update after deletion
Delete operation cannot be undone (permanent)
Loading state shown during deletion API call
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle deletion of tasks being edited by other users
Show error message if deletion fails
Prevent deletion attempts on non-existent tasks
Handle rapid deletion attempts gracefully

tasks.title: Create Progress Tracking Dashboard
tasks.description: Build a visual dashboard that shows completion statistics and progress indicators for each list and overall task management. This provides users with motivation and insights into their productivity patterns. The dashboard should highlight achievements while encouraging continued engagement with the application.
tasks.featureContext: Users need visual feedback on their progress for motivation
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard shows total tasks created and completed
Each list displays completion percentage with progress bar
Recent completion activity is highlighted
Empty state encourages task creation
Statistics update in real-time as tasks are completed
Clean, motivating visual design
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle users with no completed tasks (show encouraging message)
Calculate percentages correctly when lists have zero tasks
Handle very high task counts in statistics display
Ensure progress bars render correctly on all screen sizes

tasks.title: Build Priority Assignment System
tasks.description: Implement the ability to assign priority levels (High, Medium, Low) to tasks with visual indicators that help users identify important items quickly. Priority helps users focus on what matters most and should be prominent in the task interface without cluttering the design. The system should default to medium priority for simplicity.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to focus on high-priority tasks to maximize productivity
acceptanceCriteria: Users can select priority during task creation
Task priority can be changed after creation
High priority tasks show red indicator, medium shows yellow, low shows gray
Priority dropdown shows clear labels and colors
Default priority is 'Medium' for new tasks
Priority persists when tasks are edited
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle tasks created before priority system implementation
Ensure priority colors are accessible for colorblind users
Validate priority values in API requests
Handle priority assignment on mobile devices

tasks.title: Implement Priority-Based Task Sorting
tasks.description: Create sorting functionality that automatically arranges tasks by priority level, with high-priority items prominently displayed at the top of lists. This ensures important tasks remain visible and actionable while still allowing users to see their complete task inventory. The sorting should be intuitive and consistent across all lists.
tasks.featureContext: High-priority tasks must be visible at a glance for effective prioritization
acceptanceCriteria: Tasks automatically sort by priority (High, Medium, Low)
Within same priority, tasks sort by creation date
Completed tasks maintain priority order but appear below incomplete tasks
Sort order updates immediately when priority changes
All lists consistently apply priority sorting
Sort behavior is predictable and consistent
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle large lists with mixed priorities efficiently
Maintain sort order during task editing
Handle concurrent priority changes from multiple users
Ensure sorting works correctly with search/filter results

tasks.title: Create Search Functionality
tasks.description: Build a search interface that allows users to find specific tasks by searching through titles and descriptions. As users accumulate more tasks, the ability to quickly locate specific items becomes essential for productivity. The search should be fast, intuitive, and highlight matching terms in results.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to quickly find specific tasks as their task list grows
acceptanceCriteria: Search bar prominently placed in main interface
Search matches task titles and descriptions (case-insensitive)
Results highlight matching text
Search results update as user types (debounced)
Clear button resets search and shows all tasks
Search works within currently selected list
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle empty search queries gracefully
Show 'no results' message for searches with no matches
Handle very long search terms
Optimize search performance for users with many tasks

tasks.title: Build Filter System
tasks.description: Implement filtering capabilities that allow users to view tasks based on specific criteria including completion status, priority level, and list membership. Filters should be combinable and provide quick access to common views like 'incomplete high-priority tasks'. The interface should make active filters clearly visible and easy to modify.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to focus on specific subsets of tasks based on various criteria
riskFlags: Complex UI state management with multiple filters
acceptanceCriteria: Users can filter by completion status (all, complete, incomplete)
Users can filter by priority level (high, medium, low)
Users can filter by specific lists/categories
Multiple filters can be applied simultaneously
Active filters are clearly displayed with remove options
Filter state persists during session
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle filter combinations that return no results
Ensure filters work correctly with search results
Handle filter state when switching between lists
Optimize filter performance with large task sets

tasks.title: Implement Due Date Selection
tasks.description: Build date picker functionality that allows users to assign due dates to tasks, providing structure for time-sensitive work. The date picker should be intuitive and accessible, with options for common timeframes like 'today', 'tomorrow', and 'this week'. Due dates should be optional but prominently displayed when set.
tasks.featureContext: Users need to track time-sensitive tasks and deadlines
acceptanceCriteria: Date picker allows selecting future dates
Quick options for common dates (today, tomorrow, next week)
Due dates display clearly in task list
Users can clear due dates after setting them
Date picker is accessible on mobile devices
Due date formatting is consistent and readable
edgeCasesToHandle: Prevent selection of past dates (with warning)
Handle timezone differences correctly
Validate date inputs and show appropriate errors
Handle leap years and month boundary cases

tasks.title: Create Due Date Visual Indicators
tasks.description: Implement visual warning system that highlights tasks approaching or past their due dates using color coding and urgency indicators. This system helps users identify time-sensitive tasks at a glance without being overwhelming. The indicators should integrate seamlessly with the existing task display and priority system.
tasks.featureContext: Visual indicators provide adequate reminder functionality for time-sensitive tasks
acceptanceCriteria: Overdue tasks show red warning indicator
Tasks due today show orange 'due today' indicator
Tasks due within 3 days show yellow 'due soon' indicator
Due date indicators work alongside priority colors
Dashboard shows count of overdue and due-today tasks
Indicators update automatically as dates pass
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle tasks with due dates but no priority set
Ensure color combinations are accessible
Handle due date calculations across midnight boundary
Show appropriate indicators for completed overdue tasks

tasks.title: Optimize Mobile Responsiveness
tasks.description: Refine the application interface to provide excellent user experience across mobile devices, including touch-friendly interactions and optimized layouts. Many users will access their tasks on mobile devices, so the interface must be fully functional and intuitive on smaller screens. This includes gesture support and mobile-specific UI patterns.
tasks.featureContext: Users need full functionality on mobile devices for on-the-go task management
acceptanceCriteria: All functionality works smoothly on mobile browsers
Touch targets are appropriately sized for finger interaction
Sidebar navigation adapts to mobile screen sizes
Task editing works intuitively with touch input
Date picker is mobile-friendly and accessible
Performance remains smooth on mid-range devices
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle both portrait and landscape orientations
Ensure forms work with mobile keyboards
Optimize loading times on slower mobile connections
Handle various mobile browser quirks and differences

tasks.title: Implement Data Persistence and Sync
tasks.description: Ensure robust data persistence across browser sessions and implement automatic sync mechanisms to prevent data loss. Users expect their tasks to be reliably saved and accessible across different devices and browser sessions. This includes offline capability detection and graceful handling of connectivity issues.
tasks.featureContext: Users must trust that their task data is safely stored and accessible
acceptanceCriteria: All user changes persist immediately to backend
Application gracefully handles network disconnections
Conflict resolution for concurrent edits across devices
Local storage backup for critical task data
Clear user feedback for sync status and errors
Automatic retry mechanisms for failed sync operations
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle partial data corruption gracefully
Manage sync conflicts when same task edited on multiple devices
Provide recovery options for sync failures
Handle browser storage quota exceeded scenarios

tasks.title: Performance Optimization and Caching
tasks.description: Implement performance optimizations including efficient data loading, caching strategies, and smooth user interface interactions. As users accumulate more tasks and lists, the application must maintain fast response times and smooth performance. This includes optimizing both client-side rendering and server-side data retrieval.
tasks.featureContext: Application performance directly impacts user productivity and satisfaction
acceptanceCriteria: Task lists load in under 2 seconds on average connections
UI interactions feel responsive with minimal perceived delay
Efficient pagination or virtualization for large task lists
Intelligent caching reduces redundant API calls
Smooth animations and transitions throughout interface
Optimized bundle size and resource loading
edgeCasesToHandle: Handle cache invalidation when data changes
Optimize performance for users with hundreds of tasks
Maintain performance on slower devices and connections
Balance caching benefits with data freshness requirements

tasks.title: Final Testing and Bug Fixes
tasks.description: Conduct comprehensive testing across all features and browsers to identify and resolve bugs, ensuring a polished user experience for launch. This includes functional testing, usability testing, and edge case validation. The testing phase ensures all features work reliably in real-world usage scenarios.
tasks.featureContext: Quality assurance essential for positive user experience and adoption
riskFlags: Time pressure may limit thorough testing
acceptanceCriteria: All core user workflows function correctly
Application works across major browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
Mobile functionality verified on iOS and Android
No critical bugs or data loss scenarios
Performance meets established benchmarks
User interface polish and consistency verified
edgeCasesToHandle: Test with users who have large amounts of task data
Verify graceful degradation when features fail
Test all error scenarios and recovery paths
Validate accessibility features work correctly

cycles.name: Foundation
cycles.description: Core setup, data models, and basic infrastructure

cycles.name: Enhancement
cycles.description: Priority system, search/filter, and due date management

cycles.name: Polish & Integration
cycles.description: UI refinements, responsive design, and final optimizations
